summary: A collection of spells for assassins and vampire lords, inspired by Oblivion. Requires Dawnguard, Dragonborn and SKSE.
descriptionHtml:
[center][size=4][b]The Unwelcome Guest[/b]
[/size][size=1]Apprentice Alteration Spell[/size]

[size=3]Magically unlocks an Apprentice or lower level lock. [/size][/center][center][i][size=2]"Oh, but I was invited. By Sithis."[/size]
[/i][/center][center][size=2]It's identical to the Oblivion open effects: point, fire a magic missile, and the chest/door glows for a moment before unlocking.[/size]
Because it's a scripted effect, it's only going to work for locks in the base game + DLCs. I might make compatibility patches in future.
Tonillia will also sell scrolls that open Expert locks. I didn't make a full-on spell for them because I thought it'd be too overpowered.

[/center][center][size=4][b][/b][/size][size=4][b]Detect Pulse
[/b][/size][size=1]Adept Alteration Spell

[/size][size=3]Detects nearby living creatures for 30 seconds.[/size]

It works like the werewolf howl. You don't have to concentrate for it, just cast the spell once and reap the benefits for 30 sec.
It's weaker than the concentration version, but also costs a lot less magicka.



[size=4][b]Black Winter
[/b][/size][size=1]Adept Alteration Spell

[/size][size=3]Paralyzes the target for 2 seconds and deals 20 frost damage per second.

[/size]It's a mini-paralysis for less skilled Alteration users, with a different animation. Another little tribute to M'raaj-Dar :)[/center]


[center][size=4][b][/b][/size][size=4][b]Void Gazer
[/b][/size][size=1]Apprentice Illusion Spell

[/size][size=3]Grants toggleable night vision for 150 seconds.[/size]
[i][size=2]"What is the colour of night?"[/size][/i]

This is super useful for stealth characters who aren't vampires or Khajiit, especially along with mods that enhance dark areas.
It's completely silent and doesn't allert enemies to your position. No more lugging torches around!
I didn't edit the shaders so the vision appears desaturated and blurry on the edges. On purpose. If it's just better darkvision
with no drawbacks, it would totally defeat the point of using darkness mods for immersion in the first place.



[size=4][b]Deathly Visage
[/b][/size][size=1]Adept Illusion Spell

[/size][size=3]Makes the caster invisible and silent for 10 seconds.

[/size]A mini invisibility + muffle spell for a quick backstab. Available sooner, but lasts a lot shorter and doesn't raise Illusion skill much.



[size=4][b]Will of Sithis
[/b][/size][size=1]Expert Illusion Spell

[/size][size=3]Command Humanoid up to level 18 for 25 seconds.[/size]

It's a better version of calm + frenzy and benefits from perks that enhance the calm tree.
The catch is that it only ever works on non-undead humanoids.



[size=4][b]Night Mother's Caress
[/b][/size][size=1]Apprentice Restoration Spell

[/size][size=3]Restores 10 health per second for 5 seconds.

[/size]Cheaper than Fast Healing and is cast instantly. Doesn't stack with itself.



[size=4][b]Phantom Shroud
[/b][/size][size=1]Adept Restoration Spell

[/size][size=3]Grants 30% spell absorption for 60 seconds.

[/size]Finally some magical defence that isn't a ward. I've always thought wards cost too much magicka for what they do.



[size=4][b]Void Surge
[/b][/size][size=1]Expert Destruction Spell

[/size][size=3]Deals 115 magical damage to a single target, but drains a portion of the caster's health.[/size]
[i][size=2]"Too simple. Too safe. None of them truly understood the glory of the Destruction school..."[/size][/i]

Sinister red Sith lightning! We all know how badly Skyrim needed that.
It's not shock damage and doesn't scale with the shock perks. To make up for it, it deals slightly more damage than fully
augmented Thunderbolt, but doesn't damage magicka and costs 15% of your current health every time it connects.



[size=4][b]Soul Prison
[/b][/size][size=1]Master Conjuration Spell

[/size][size=3]Sends a humanoid into the Soul Cairn for 10 seconds, causing its soul to evaporate and lose 250 health.

[/size]This is a ritual spell so it doesn't benefit from dual-casting, but the damage is huge, comparable to the Soul Tear shout.
It works on black souls (living humanoids) and erases them from the world for 10 seconds. If they die in the Soul Cairn,Â 
they will reappear as black skeletons, to reflect that they're now soulless husks.
This spell is only available to Vampire Ladies/Lords who purchase it from Ronthil.[/center]
author: Winter Flower
